channel.title: Java HELP!
channel.description:
something went wrong with my java, and now i can't open any file that is .jar ive tried the to fix it with tuts from youtube but nothing i still can't get it to work. so when i click on the file cmd pops up and close's really fast.
here are some pictures. http://i.imgur.com/malA7.jpg http://i.imgur.com/vWKho.jpg http://i.imgur.com/0iKdj.jpg

item.title: Java HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

[quote=“Pure Slay, post:8, topic:430022”][quote author=Acorn_ link=topic=532703.msg3897678#msg3897678 date=1327456227]
Had it happen to me before when I was a noob, a quick fix is just to set back your computer a day or two.
[/quote]

What lmao? That isn’t going to do anything, refer to my post (if you are talking about the jar’in)

As for the main post, why would that affect what your preferred program is to open a file…[/quote]
Posted my reply on the wrong thread by accident, but this could also apply to this if he set back his computer to a time before he fucked things up because he obviously doesn’t understand what he’s doing at the moment…

Read full topic

item.title: Java HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

No Namedd v2:

how do i fix? or can you post a link of a video to help me?

If you are using jar maker, such hit manifest template and write the name of the executable class on the line shown.

Read full topic

item.title: Java HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

[quote=“No Namedd v2, post:3, topic:430022”]this what i have, http://i.imgur.com/Cygkk.jpg
and ive tried that environment varibles, and it still doesn’t let me open the .jar
now it says that i changed it to the javaw.exe[jdk]
http://i.imgur.com/e1kCE.jpg[/quote]

You changed it properly, it is simply the fact that you either did not set a proper, or did not set a main class at all when you were jar’in your files.

Read full topic

item.title: Java HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

Open With -> Select File Java™ Platform SE Binary (javaw.exe I believe)

Program Files -> Java -> JDK -> Bin

Read full topic
